nodes.bodyText:
If you aren't handling exceptions, there is no reason to catch them.
See Sample Style Guide.
It might still be a good idea to mention they might occur in a comment.

References to Insert should be updated to Update to match the sample tag. The VenueId values should also be updated (as per the suggestions) to match existing rows in the table.
Would the table not already having this entries from the previous test?

No, JUnit (the Java test framework) does not guarantee the order in which tests are executed, and it is strongly recommended for this and other reasons to create test cases that are completely independent of all other test cases. So this test case cannot rely on any data already being present in the table, as there is no guarantee that this test case is executed after any of the other test cases.
(An exception to the above rule is normally made for heavy weight operations like creating the data model. That is created only once for the entire test file.)
